Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in even better location - what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: nadeemcrowe
Reviews.Content: I am currently in Madrid on a city break on my own. This is my third of four nights here. I normally stay at the trendy hotels out of town so you get more bang for your buck but got a great deal here so thought I would give it a try. Here is the low down: 1. The location - amazing; right on gran via; I have not used the metro since I got off it having arrived from the airport. You can walk everywhere and you are right near the Temple of Debod which is the most amazing place I have ever sunbathed in Europe. 2. The rooms - spacious, clean, everything you need; quiet; really comfy beds - I have slept like I was at home and when the rooms are cleaned in the morning they are immaculate. 3. Free gym with enough to keep those churros pounds off In summary - this hotel has been perfect - it is so much more personal than the business hotels and yes reception could be more personable but to be frank they are there to do a job and they do it perfectly well. If youre visiting Madrid - stay here; it just makes sense.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at TRYP Menfis”
Reviews.Author: Yar521
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to the tran station and the city center, friendly staff, clean rooms, reasonable price. It smelled bad, more like sea food in the lobby. We were welcomed by a tray of fruits and bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ang702
Reviews.Content: By taxi from the airport it took about 20 minutes, but if you are familiar with using metro, one of the stops is only a couple of minutes walk. Upon arrival, when we walked in we were smacked in the face by this nasty fish odor which remained our entire stay. The reception spoke English, and were for the most part pleasant and helpful. The room was an average size in Europe. The biggest disappointment is that there was only WiFi on the 2nd floor, so every time we needed to use the internet we had to go downstairs. The hotel was comfortable and safe, but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Snir K
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in the hotel for a week, and enjoyed the clean hotel,the well equipped room, the balcony overviewing madrid, a staff that was always willing to help, a good breakfast, free safe -and most important: the great location! 50 m from the metro,located in the main street Gran Via - you can go anywhere and be at the hotel in 15 minutes (important when you do shopping). great great great location and a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: sazzle94
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you are are travelling from Madrid airport by metro, it's literally fifty yards from the metro stop. Which was great for us as we arrived during a freak thunderstorm and had to make a quick dash when it was pouring down. We went on an open top bus tour of the city, the bus stop is only a five minute walk from the hotel too. Our room was on the 7th floor at the front of the hotel, we couldn't hear any traffic noise, but I could hear people moving around the hotel during the day. The rooms looked quite sparse on the hotel website but they aren't really, just decorated in a simple contemporary style. Everything was lovely and clean, the bathroom was small but nice. If you want a plush four star hotel this probably isn't for you but there are lots of other Melias in Madrid if you want to pay a bit more. We were only in Madrid for one day and it was perfect for us, you can't beat the price for a city centre hotel with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: regular-traveller25
Reviews.Content: Above defines this place. Hotel is simple, nothing fancy, but clean rooms, staff is very nice and helpful and location is great, that combined with a good price, makes it a really nice place to stay in Madrid. Highly recommendable unless you are looking for high end places. Specifically, location and staff makes the difference (my elderly parents were staying there before I arrived, and the staff went beyond their way to help me communicate with them every time I called).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a little price for the quality of hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkim8728
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right by the Gran Via, which is the main street of Madrid. Lots of shopping. Also, it is close to Plaza de Espana. A lot of tours leave from this plaza. Our room was clean but furniture are outdated. Need some make overs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin1978
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in the hotel. Staff is very friendly and speaks good English. WiFi is available on the first 3 floors. Rooms were clean and well decorated. There is some repair going on outside but as we were not in the hotel during the day it did not disturb us. Prices are very reasonable. Breakfast was perfect with very good choice of food, especially pastry. The only complaint - there was no bottle opener anywhere in the hotel:-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at Gran Via near Spanich square”
Reviews.Author: ksiazemati
Reviews.Content: Te hotel is located really good. Few steps from Plaza de Espana. Plaza de Espana subway station ( connecting station of red, yellow and navy) is just few steps from hotel - 50m. There is also Green and bue line close to the hotel. By walk You can get from there to Opera, Sol, San Miguel squer with it excellent market / tapas bazaar square. The rooms were not so big and modern but clean. There was no sound to hear from outside. The breakfast offer was big and good. Minibar with beers was included. The staff was ok but quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: paula048
Reviews.Content: visited for three nights 17th to 19th February. This is a slightly old-fashioned, comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The breakfasts are excellent. Not recommended for those seeking ultra modern surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Declan T
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my partner on the Thursday night of the 9th of February 2012. It happens alot as people assume, but we were given a twin room (id booked a double with hotels.com) The man on the desk could not have been more helpful and apologetic and even up graded our room to a beautiful double overlooking the main grand Via. Bathroon was a bit small but managable and with room service, satalite tv, mini bar and free wii fi, it was very comfortable, You were always greeted by a friendly "Hola" leaving and entering the hotel at any time. Widows were virtually sound proof securing a sound sleep, I dont like heating from an aircon unit as its quite drying on the throat but I can appreciate this is more convienient than seperate heating and air con.The maid was discreet, thorough and seemed to work around the guests as opposed to hereself. With the metro outside the door everwhere in the city is easy to access and its just one tram change to the airport. I got the 5 day tourist pass covering trams and buses for 19 euros which is great value. Its ideally located for a short walk to the chuccea district. We loved our stay here, and hope to go back ( when warmer) :)

Reviews.Title: “Location is overated”
Reviews.Author: IsabelTM
Reviews.Content: Most reviewers like this hotel because of its location. But Gran Via is no longer the commercial centre of Madrid, It is nice yo be able to walk to Puertas del Sol but the street is verynoisy and buildings look a bit decrepit. I usually choose to stay at hotels in the Salamanca district but this time the organizers of the conference booked this one because of the easier access to the university, The hotel is good, the room was very good with a balcony overlooking Gran Via and Plaza de España, Everything was clean and nicely decorated. They give free acces to internet with cable on your room or wireless on the lobby and first floor rooms. Breakfast is excellent and staff is very nice and seems happy to help you.My room was a bit noisy but you can ask for a quiet room overlooking the interior patio, if you have trouble sleeping with traffic noise. I slept perfectly because the windows had a very good blackout curtain,The worst thing about this hotel are the two flights of stairs you have to climb to have access to the lobby. It was built when there were porters to hold the door for you and bellboys to carry you luggage. Even with just a small trolley I had some difficulty climbing those stairs because I have a tendinitis. Young couples with babies had the same trouble with their own trolleys...

Reviews.Title: “No value for your money”
Reviews.Author: vagotay
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 17 yrs old daughter and a friend from childhood to Madrid after a recent relocation to Dublin, Ireland. Coming from Puerto Rico (Caribbean) we wanted to explore "La Madre Patria". We made reservations online through priceline for a three people bedroom and pay the extra price for that 3rd bed. We arrived at the hotel and they declined to give us the third bed unless we paid an extra fee of 38€ a night. We were staying for 7 nights. So we stparted with the wrong foot there and it cause a lot of greive to my friend, she cried of frustration for hours as she was counting to spend that money shopping souvenirs and in attractions rather than paying twice for that bed! The hotel claims to be a 4 star hotel, it is located in the main avenua Gran Via. its location is very convenient however there are much less expensive hotels even closer to main attractions. The hotel is outdated, and o ld, not in a historic sense but in a need some remodeling sense. The lobby is pretty small, the room we were given after paying extra money for the 3rd bed had a decent size to accomodate the extra bed, but the bathroom was tiny. Again, the price was super high, we ended up paying about 2,000€, they did not honored the price we paid when we did reservation, no free internet- not even at the lobby, no breakfast in luded, no gym, no nothing. It was more of a two star hotel, so don't spend your money in this hotel as yoiu will not get the value from it. Not to mention that the hotel had a problem with electricty the morning we were leaving and it was so dark we couldn't even tell where our stuff was.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Jaceofbass
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location off of Gran Via..the rooms are pretty nice and clean, and some staff are more helpful than others. The biggest disappointment is that there was no wifi above the first two floors, and the service that DID exist on those two floors cost an additional hourly fee. That was a bummer. The breakfast was nice though. I didn't hate my experience there but I'd be hesitant to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SHVRome
Reviews.Content: Very central location and huge bedroom. The balcony looked out over the street, but the sound proofing was excellent. We were the envy of our friends for having this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location * Walking Distance to Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: XFisher
Reviews.Content: From this hotel you can walk to a metro station (a few meters away), Tourist Bus Stop, or if you like and enjoy walking, you can walk to Cibeles, El Prado Museum, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, Barrio Latino. The ladies an the front desk (morning) were very helpful and friendly. I cannot say the same thing about the guys in the afternoon and night. We definitely did not like the breakfast at the hotel. Coffee was awful (to say the least), but there are PLENTY of places to eat close by. Rooms were of good size and clean. We cannot complain about noises, our room faced the back street. I agree with reviewer Sakarah, they should not charge for WiFi which works only in the lobby and first floor, so BEWARE of this.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Sakarah
Reviews.Content: Went there on a 1-day business trip. Pros: Rooms are big and clean and the breakfast is quite good, with a huge variety. The hotel itself is located near everything, if you're looking for some fun after work. Also, stayed in a room facing the street but heard no noise whatsoever. Cons: staff was helpful but not terribly pleasant. Charging such prices for wi-fi is a big no-no these days for business customers. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and affordable”
Reviews.Author: ainparis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located (just a 2 minute walk to the Plaza de España metro stop) and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Just make sure to ask for a room at the back of the hotel as the ones facing Gran Via can be quite noisy. There was a nice, big flat screen TV in our room, however we could only watch 3-4 channels because there was no TV reception. There was also no Internet connection in our room. We had to go to the lobby to access the Wi-Fi connection (which costs 8 Euros a day). Our bathroom was missing a bath towel so I called to request one. However we never received it and ended up going to the lobby and getting it ourselves. This hotel is good for a weekend stay especially if you don't want to spend a lot of money. However I wouldn't recommend this for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “"Can't really fault it"”
Reviews.Author: Arthur W
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the Menfis on a city break and found it to be everything that could be required for such a break. The rooms were clean and comfortable and, as a previous reviewer has stated, we had a rear facing room which cuts out all traffic noise from the Grand Via, and as this seems to have loud speeding traffic 24/7 the room suited us perfectly. The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. We did try breakfast on our first morning and while it was a good breakfast we found it somewhat expensive at 9 euros (special offer, reduced from 15), but as there was an abundance of cafes and bars within a few minutes serving cheap wholesome food, this didn't present a problem. The situation of the hotel is perfect for visiting all the city's attractions and the open top bus tours stop just up the road. We arranged airport transfer before travelling as we were arriving late at night, but returned to the airport by metro from Plaza de Espana station, this was just as quick and a fraction of the cost. All in all a perfect hotel for our city break.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and central, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: lagerfeld
Reviews.Content: We stayed for almost a week at the hotel and, although the rooms are very spacious and clean, we're surprised that a 4* hotel would charge a daily fee for wifi use of over 10 euros. Apart from that, we didn't get a single smile from anyone in the staff the whole time we were there, and even when I asked if i could borrow an adaptor (which most hotels have to spare) she rudely said 'No, you'll have to get it at el Corte Ingles". The reception was cold and we weren't greeted at the entrance and instead, had to drag our suitcases up the stairs in the reception and 'queue' to be rudely welcomed The hotel is central, in one end of the busiest roads in Madrid, so if you're looking for relaxing, this is not the place. If, on the other hand, you're willing to walk everywhere and want to get a lot done, then the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: eowyngirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Menfis last weekend during a 3 day visit to Madrid and found it to be perfectly adequate given the price (on special for about £47 per night) and its location (near Plaza de Espana on Gran Via). The good: - Location - very close to the action located on Gran Via near the Plaza de Espana metro stop, although now that I've been to Madrid the location probably isn't as important as in other cities. The Metro is open until about 2am so unless you're into some hard clubbing you would get better bang for your buck in other barrios like Salamanca, etc. Having said that - Gran Via is very busy with no shortage of shops, cafes and bars. Extremely convenient! Also good transport links to Atocha Renfre (train station) and Chamartin, the two main stations used if you want to do day trips to Toledo or Segovia. - Service was good and efficient. Recommended. The bad: - Breakfast: They tried to sell the breakfast to me for EUR9 but I cannot stress enough that this is NOT NECESSARY. Gran Via is litterd with cafes all offering breakfasts (including coffee and a pastry usually) that are less than EUR3 pp. Breakfasts aren't big in Madrid as you can then get the Menu del Dia in most restaurants for around EUR10-EUR15 pp - 3 course meals to save your appetite for!

Reviews.Title: “Inferior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jontycLondon
Reviews.Content: The good - location The bad - poor air conditioning, no hot water at times, fire alarm kept going off, room keys continually stopped working, staff not exactly friendly or in abundance

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE: ok location, shocking hotel, RUDE staff”
Reviews.Author: manabouttowntraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel fire alarm kept going off causing an entire night without sleep. Instead of apologising and offering compensation, the hotel staff threatened to call the police when I asked for a discount. The manager later made an unauthorized payment on my credit card. I wouldn't recommend this shabby hotel to my worst enemy. To boot, no WIFI available, shocking service. Surly unfriendly door staff. No hot water at times.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: mrpastry186338
Reviews.Content: Providing your not expecting a top class hotel then this one is more than acceptable, excellent location only two min walk from metro, good size clean room, average bathroom, breakfast was pretty good with wide choice,(make sure you book day before, then it is only 9 euro ) . Sure this hotel is not perfect and you can find fault if you want to, but overall perfectly adequate. I would go back no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: mat210589
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days in early May 2011. When looking for a hotel we wanted somewhere central, with nice modern rooms as we were planning to eat out each night and not take advantage of any bar/restaurant facilities that the hotel might offer. Tryp Menfis ticked all the boxes for our preferred type of stay. The cleanliness and presentation of the room was beautiful and we were lucky enough to have a balcony looking onto Gran Via. We didn't take advantage of room service or the mini bar provided but both held the basics you would expect.The only two downsides was the noise at night (sadly expected if you want to stay on Gran Via itself) and the reception area was getting renovated during our stay so we had to be directed to the first floor by signs on arrival. Staff were helpful, but we didn't really need to approach reception apart from to check in and check out. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel for couples or friends wanting a hotel close to all central attractions that does exactly as it says on the tin. I know we would both make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but slow, patchy service and terrible quality of sleep”
Reviews.Author: river_ock
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tryp Menfis on a short holiday to Madrid this month. I got a reasonable price on the place ("top secret" through lastminute.com). If I went to Madrid again, I would not stay at this hotel another time. Although it was centrally located on Gran Via, and reasonably clean and appointed, I found the service patchy, and I really didn't sleep well. SERVICE: when I arrived, the keycard for my room did not work owing to some problem with their computer system. The man on reception was polite enough about it, but didn't attend to it with any obvious urgency (which would have been nice for someone who was coming from the airport and quite tired). The keycard failed on another occasion while I was there. These were minor, but irritating inconveniences. When I was leaving, I deposited my luggage for a little shopping before going back to the airport. When I returned to collect it, there was a huge queue of people building up, and the staff on reception were quite relaxed about it. Needing to rush off to get my plane, I was a bit annoyed to see that the staff were having a very pleasant little chat with each person. Madrilenos are very friendly - and that's why it's nice to go there - but maybe this behaviour is not so appropriate at busy times. SLEEP: I stayed on the 7th floor. The walls were extremely thin, meaning that I could hear, through one wall, the bleep of the lift, and through most of the walls the noise of people passing my room to go to theirs (at all hours, this being Madrid). A further problem is noise from the connecting doors along the corridors. All the connecting doors are on a magnetic switch, which keeps them open during the day, but they swing shut at night. When people come back in the later hours, these heavy connecting doors must be opened, and then they swing to, heavily, and with a loud bang that woke me up several times each night. It was not good to sleep in this hotel. So my advice - don't stay here if you like to sleep. If you're a true gato, and out until 5am, it will bother you less, of course!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in the heart of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Demetrio-T
Reviews.Content: Quality Hotel with professional and smiley staff! I booked this hotel from lastminute.com website at a very good fare. I mentioned in may confirmation e-mail to the hotel that i was traveling in my honey moon and at the arrival they surprise us with a nice welcome gift, a bottle of Spanish Champagne like in ice bucket and welcome card. The room was very nice with a top view, quiet and very clean as well. Front office desk officer was very polite and nice, as he give as maps and travel guide for free and a lot of information's about place to visit in Madrid. Tryp Menphis Hotel is located in the center of Madrid on the Calle Gran Via at walking distance by many important and nice places to visit in Madrid. Our best regards and thanks to the manager and the hotel staff for the welcome and the nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Maggie144
Reviews.Content: Having worked at a major hotel chain as a Director of Training, I can assess and evaluate a hotel's service level in accurate manner. The management of Tryp Menfis should re-train its staff as they have poor customer service skills ( no smile/welcome, no eye-contact, rude words, etc ). Suggest the following: - Conduct at least 30 hours of customer service training for entire staff in English including cross-cultural communication to cater to international guests. For instance, the front desk staff could be trained to proactively share the map of the hotel area as well as recommended local restaurants/shows nearby when the guests check-in. A welcome packet would be nice; - Place a bellman to help their guests to bring up the luggage (4 star hotel must have this function) and set up a luggage deposit system (when a guest leaves his/her luggage, the hotel should give the numbered ticket to the guest as a receipt); - Air Conditioning is out-dated and make a loud noise. This should be included in the hotel's long-term capital investment plan to upgrade the system. Hope this helps to improve the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, average breakfast, poor TV.”
Reviews.Author: Arefaat
Reviews.Content: The location is good for shopping and dinning, however the hotel staff rarely speak English, you need to have some knowledge about Spanish language to communicate with them. TV is very poor, mostly Spanish channels, No English speaking entertainment channels (only News and Science), very boring if you have to spend the evening in your room. Internet connection is at the desk (no WiFi) so you have to sit at the disk if you need to use the internet and they provide you with a very short cables (I had to buy a long cable to move around the room with my laptop). Breakfast is average, very limited items, specially if you're on diet. Cleanliness is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Clarification
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Tryp Menfis in April when the volcanic ash disruption started so ended up there a few more nights! The staff were extremely friendly and accomadating when it came to the daily checking out and in again. I am very grateful to the staff for all their help.The hotel lived up to expectations in that the rooms were exactly the standard they appear on the website and were very clean. Gran Via is very noisy of course so there is a lot of noise even on the top floors (between the 4 of us we ended up staying in 5 separate rooms!) but the location next to the metro makes up for this and I imagine it is the same most places in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Get a good deal and working aircon in your room and you'll be very happy”
Reviews.Author: Chris_R34
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights whilst visiting Madrid in early September. Average temp was 35 degrees. Rooms were very clean, good size and bathroom was excellent. Service was good from the front desk. Location is on the Gran Via and moments away from the Metro. Lots of cafes and places to enjoy tapas just outside the hotel. We got a 50% discount deal through lastminute.com, paid about 37 GBP a night for the room without breakfast. Only problem was the aircon didn't work on the second night so I didn't get much sleep. When the aircon did work is was comfortable enough. Get a tourist pass for the Metro by the way. 11.80 Euros for 3 days each. You can buy them from the Airport Metro station. Great value, which I think you'll need as Madrid is quite expensive...and I'm used to London prices! Also, San Miguel market is a great place to eat tapas in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Inability to resolve problems in a timely manner”
Reviews.Author: jorgemb
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms for four days. The Air Conditioning in one room did not work at all and struggled in the two others. We complained in the first night and were promised a repair each night. The problem was not resolved until the third night. Even in the best facilities, I expect things to go wrong every once in a while. These events provide an occasional window into how a staff responds to adversity. A four star hotel should do a lot better at correcting a problem of this nature. Management offered us a 15% discount for the inconvenience at the end of the stay and this was appreciated but I would have much preferred an uneventful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Met all Our Requirements with Ease”
Reviews.Author: Whitey30
Reviews.Content: We had booked into the Tryp Washington but they had overbooked and put us in the ajoining Tryp Menfis which is a 4 star. The upgrade was much appreciated especially as we had a good deal of 59 euros per night throught Booking.com (Trip Advisor (TA)and Solmelia websites are useful for offer prices). A very friendly young lady on reception offered us a twin room with balcony on the 7th floor facing Gran Via. She also offered us a deal on breakfast at 8 Euros each per day. The room was large with very big, comfortable twin beds. There is plenty of traffic noise but the double glazing was effective and we had undisturbed sleep. The aircon is not very effective and it may be quite hot in the height of summer. The ensuite was smallish but claen, modern and adequate. The hotel is spotless and comfortable and we found the staff to be very friendly and efficient. Breakfast was excellent and good value. The hotel is well located for a city break. The metro stn (plaza de espana) is about 40yds away, the Madrid Vision Bus tour stops 100yds away, there are very many restaurants of all kinds everywhere, and the city centre is a 10 min walk. Many of the must sees are within walking distance. We were there for 3 nights which was about right for us as we did not want to spend time in the many museums. We bought a 2 day ticket for Madrid Vision City Tour Bus for 10 euros each which let us do both red and blue routes to get our bearings and then get on and off to visit attractions. Tickets can be bought online, at the hotel or on the bus. Must see sites are: Stop 21 Egyptian Temple, Stop2 Royal Palace (long queues in the morning) and Cathedral , Stop4 Basilica de San Francisco El Grande (fabulus but closed from1-4pm), Stop6 Plaza Mayor, Stop 13 Retiro Park, and any of the museums that appeal. There are all kinds of eating places from "all you can eat buffets" at 9 euros each to very high class restaurants. We searched out a few recommendations from Trip Advisor and particularly liked La Gloria de Montera at about 20 euros and Cornucopia at about 24 euros a head for 2 courses with wine - both are within a 10 min walk from the hotel and can be found on the TA maps. We also enjoyed Cafe de Oriente, overlooking the Royal Palace, for a lunchtime beer and tapas. We had a great time and would recommend the hotel especially at the prices we found. Be aware that the airport taxis take 35 mins and run on meters which indicate about 32 euros but then they add about 10 euros for an airport surcharge. They are convenient but expensive at 84 Euros return. The train is very much cheaper if that is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “pathetic welcome, never again”
Reviews.Author: rosecaresse
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a short city break over easter holidays, it was last leg of our tour. we had great experience at other 4 star hotels in barcelona,tren hotel, granada and then we came to madrid. we booked this hotel while we are still in spain, using phone wifi available for free in other hotels. we read its reviews on trip advisor and chose it for its offer prize. we reached there at 11 after 5 hours journey in a train and were treated in a very rude way.Firstly we waited 20 minutes just to be spoken to as there was another couple trying to buy tour bus tickets ahead of us. no one else showed up and we waited to check in. last we got the chance and the staff after checking our identity and confirming our reservation, of which they had full documentation, still insisted on us to provide them with a print out of booking. despite explaining that it was not possible during travel, as we dont carry printers in pockets, they insisted on us to buy internet wifi voucher and to email them booking detail again. we asked for an email address of manager which they did not provide. The room had few broken bits on floor, the wood paneling of side walls was coming off. Climate control was not working in 19 degree temperature. The looby was shabby and untidy. on the positive note, beds were comfortable, bath room was clean and room had safe. we did not complaint as we did not want to spoil our holiday. for staff 1 star hotel over all 3 star location 4 star

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: myosotis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and functional, our room was fairly large and quiet, large and very comfortable bed and other amenities. The bathroom was a bit small, but we weren't in Madrid to lock ourselves in the bathroom anyhow! The breakfast was pretty good to start the day. A good choice of sweet and savory options (from eggs to local churros and fruit). If you come in with a lot of luggage, be aware that there's no bell service, you'll have to bring them to your room. Similarly, if you come by car, be awara that the hotel is right on the Gran Via, there's no place to even stop your car, you'll need to leave it in a underground parking close to the hotel (expensive). If you're traveling light and without car, then this shouldn't be a problem. The staff was nice. You can purchase an internet connection from your room, or get free wifi on the 1st floor. The best thing about this hotel is its location. I am not a fan of the Gran Via, but of all the neighborhoods that are right around it: you can walk to Malasana, Chueca, to the Plaza Mayor area. The hotel is really in the center of it all. It has a metro stop just steps away and several rental cars in Plaza de Espana.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, breakfast, location”
Reviews.Author: Paulista1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tryp Menfis for 6 nights. Good buffet breakfast for EUR 8 + VAT. Rooms are adequate, but temperature control is indeed useless - our room was an oven! The only way of cooling it down was opening the window. The voicemail had broken down during our stay and was never fixed - I believe I left some unheard messages. Nice location - you can walk to every sight and plenty of restaurants and cafes within a short stroll. Overall a good value hotel, if you don't need business services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Picu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a premium location, walking distance to the major tourist attractions and a 5-min walk to the Royal Palace. The rooms are clean and spacious. The promotional breakfast for 8 euros per person was excellent! It has a nice gym, but no free WIFI. The staff was very friendly, but then again, I am a native Spanish speaker and knowing the language often makes all the difference in the world. The hotel is pricey. I don't know where everyone finds these promotional rates, but the best I could do was about 100 euros per night. I thought it was a good value for the price and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “29 eur, dont pay more, dont go in winter or summer”
Reviews.Author: IRBaboonLondon
Reviews.Content: stayed there recently, only paid 29 eur due to a large sale the group had after crisis glad i didnt pay more location good, rooms nice and clean but as noted by all others staff are soviet union style, rooms were all cold as the weaher was cold and the in room system just blew the same air round with no change of temperature, (tried three different rooms!) didnt take my coat off inside for three days, i assume in summer teh same sytem would not cool down a room either, maybe april and september are the only two montsh you could stay here staff were so sympathetic that one conjured up the energy to shrug his shoulders baffles me that its a 4 star fitness centre was so cold it was dangerous to exercise avoid........................

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: marsuhoo
Reviews.Content: Front desk service was a bit rude when we got in and they didn't hesitate to show that they've dealt with enough customers for one day... They were not interested that there were wrong names and genders (right nationality though) in the hotel documents. "they are only for the police, don't worry!" Rooms were nice and spacious + clean and quiet. Some small things were broken in the room and the bathroom but since it didn't bother our stay, we didn't complain. Lobby was a bit untidy which you wouldn't expect from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the same as shown on their web site. No hidden catch, a very practical and comfortable hotel right at the center of touristic Madrid. We chose this hotel as it was a family trip as we were not interested in spending too much time at the hotel and were very satisfied with what we got. We normally stay either at the Westin Palace or Vincci Soho, both had very high prices during the time we wanted to visit. The rooms of Tryp Menfis are of good size and are spotless. Furniture is new and modernish. Kind of like Scandinavian/Classic. Bathroom on the smaller side but nice and clean. One of our rooms had a heating problem. The room facing Gran Via had some street noise but it was not as bad as a Midtown NYC hotel. Hotel breakfast buffet was decent. Condisdering the rate we paid (under 70€ incl. breakfast), it was a good buffet. They even had churros. If you like to be at the center of everything, and do not mind the world passing by the door of the hotel, this one is great for you. Walking distance to many areas including Sol, Preciados, Thyssen Museum. If you want tranquility, this area is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Tourisita
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Tryp Menfis from November 1 to November 5th 2009. This hotel is centrally located on Gran Via, a very busy street. Our room was quite specious, which surprised me as I heard about rooms being small in size. Both room and the bathroom were very clean. Room has a wooden floor and I was again surprised to find it to be super clean!! The bed was comfy! There is a minibar, from which we used one soda one day and I believe the charge was 2 euro. We got the room which didn't face Gran Via and we didn't hear any noise whatsoever from the street or from other rooms. So we were very lucky about that. There was a balcony, but not an impressive view as it was off Gran Via, which was fine by us.. This room had a safe, which we used extensively. It had all the typical things that a hotel room has- hair dryer, glasses, cups. However, this room didn't have any coffee making facilities. We would have liked it but seriously I was so in love with Cafe con leche that I highly doubt I would have made any coffee in the hotel room and not drink Cafe con leche. And we were out most of the time anyway! So, it wasn't an issue for us. Our iron was missing in the room so my husband just made a ph call to reception and they sent it within 5 minutes. I have heard tons of things regarding the room temp problem mainly during Summer how the rooms were extremely hot and AC not working properly. When I booked this hotel, I got such a good rate that I didn't consider that as a problem and besides I thought by November it would be cold anyway, so, this issue of room being too hot would be moot. However, first two nights the room was quite cold, which meant something was really wrong with the heating system. My husband called the reception and they instructed him to adjust the temp so and so and it worked, but could have been better. While we were there they were having a promotion of breakfast 7 or 8 euro per person breakfast, but we didn't use that. There is a VIPS right across the hotel, where we had breakfast most of the time. And there are countless other restaurants within 5-10 minutes of walking distance to any direction from the hotel. Check in was easy- we got there really early around 8 in the morning. Reception told us that room is not ready and housekeeper would come at 9 and our room would be ready by 10. We went outside leaving the baggage with them, and by the time we came back at 11 it was ready. Check out was easy as well. I informed them night before to call a taxi for us and they did. Plaza de Espana metro is literally a block away from the hotel. Once you get out walk right and cross the street and metro station is there. There are 3 or 4 other metro stations within 5 minutes walking distance. As far as tourist attractions, on one direction from the hotel Plaza de Espana, Templo de Debod, Royal Palace are very close. So are Sol and Plaza Mayor on the other direction. If you stay at this hotel to visit these places you won't need to use the metro at all. I would definitely stay at this hotel again based on the cleanliness of the room/hotel, location and hassle free reception. I booked this hotel back in March for our trip in November on booking dot com. And I got a super deal, non-refundable but it was 243 euro for 5 nights and I took this opportunity right away!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great!!”
Reviews.Author: Mentalmags
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through late rooms.com. Thank goodness we didn't pay full price! Hotel just ok. Check in was very slow and no apology given for the time taken. Our room was fine, kinda small but clean. View from balcony was onto appartments on side street. Think we got this room as we did not pay full price. Room did not have coffee or tea making facilities which for a four star hotel I would have thought should hae been standard! However we were out most of the day so only used the hotel to sleep. The location was ok but would not stay on Gran Via again as it was VERY noisy most of the day and night. Needed to use earplugs to sleep! As I said was ok but would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff/Wonderful Location/Excellent Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: vegas24
Reviews.Content: We were first time visitors to Madrid from the US. The hotel is a few feet away from the Plaza de Espana Metro Station. This was very convenient as we took the Metro to and from the airport. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Palacio Real. Restaurants and shopping were plentiful along Gran Via. The hotel is a short walk to the Chueca district which we loved. The hotel staff spoke excellent English and were very accommodating. My friend fell ill and the staff helped us locate a pharmacy and recommended a few OTC meds, as the pharmacy had no US OTC meds for colds. The room was as pictured on the web site. The beds were comfortable. We loved our room on the front of the hotel with a balcony overlooking Gran Via. We would definitely stay at this hotel when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service/room for price value”
Reviews.Author: TexasKPB
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon trip for 5 nights. We wanted something nice but not overpriced since we had splurged on other luxury hotels and most of the time we would be out sightseeing etc.. This hotel is in the heart of downtown near the shopping district and other restaurants. You have easy walking access to the train / metro bus / taxis. Due to my mess up we checked in to find I had booked us for the wrong date - a year out!! Here is where it gets good - they not only find us a room but upgrade us due to my error. This was fantastic customer service and I was blown away. The room was so clean and modern. The furniture was nice and the bathroom had all the amenities plus complimentary toiletries. You get a robe and slippers and they change your linens every day. There is a safe and a large closet w/ ironing board and iron. They have wooden floors and there is a fridge. If you are a business traveller or frequent traveller I would really recommend this place. If you are American - I would compare this to a really nice Holiday Inn. I would return here if I was coming back. Great value - I did extensive research on TripAdvisor before booking and it paid off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: archie1978
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, central, close to everything. On the main road that has a tourist bus (good for sightseeing). Staff quite helpful and room was large, clean and free internet. The only downside is that the entrance to the hotel is up-the-stairs through double doors and managing that with multiple pieces of luggage is very difficult and there was no porter. Otherwise happy with hotel (executive room).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: Southoffranceman
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online and got a very good deal..172€ for three nights room only. The position is fantastic. Metro from airport with one change lands you within 50 metres of hotels front door. We arrived at 9.15 am just hoping to leave bags so we could go off to explore and check in later. We were offered a room straight away...asked for a quiet room and thats what we got...reception staff could not have been more helpful. Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance and major attractions close `by The decor is very nice and room very comfortable with all things you would expect...lots of nice freebies in bathroom....razor toothpaste toothbrush etc...all very thoughtful...again on checking out no prob keeping luggage until we wanted to collect it at 20.00 for late flight

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing..not recommended”
Reviews.Author: gizz_10
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel in Madrid for 3 nights over 2 subsequent weekends in June. The first was Thurs-Sun, and I booked the Tryp Menfis. Although tempted to book it for the following weekend from Fri-Sun as well, I decided I would hold fire and see what the experience was like before re-booking for the following week, and I have to say I am very glad that I waited, as I had no intention of returning to the Tryp Menfis after my first experience. On arrival at the hotel, you are greeted with stairs to climb up to reception, with no ramp to wheel up your suitcases, so you have to carry them up yourself. The hotel has no bell boys or concierge service. Not a huge deal but something to be aware of if you have heavy bags with you that you cannot manage. Although I had booked a double-bedded room, the front desk allocated me a room with 2 single beds, so I was forced to return to reception to request that they move me to a double room as per my booking. It seems that most hotels in Spain always try to farm you off with a twin-bedded room in the first instance, and I recommend checking before you head up to the room. The guy on reception was helpful enough but said that I would have to have a smoking room at the back of the hotel if I wanted a double bed, even though I had booked a non-smoking double room. I was ok with being at the back of the hotel as it is quieter at night than facing onto the main Gran Via. The weekend I was there was one of the hottest they had experienced all summer with the temperature hitting 41C. The air conditioning in the room did not seem to work at all well, even before the temperature surge, and it was unbearably warm in the hotel room. There is no way to set the temperature on the thermostat - you can just choose, Low, Med and High - and none of these seemed any different from each other. I do not believe it was Air conditioning at all, just a very light fan that you could barely feel. After the first unpleasant night I called down to reception and advised that I didn't think that the AC was working. The receptionist made no attempt to send anyone to the room to investigate - and proceeded to respond by saying no one had complained about the AC before and suggested that perhaps it was me that had a problem. I knew this to be untrue as I had seen some reviews (after booking) on Trip advisor already complaining about the AC. I asked if housekeeping could provide me with a fan in the room, and he point blank refused and said that they didn't keep any fans on the premises. I asked what he would do if the AC really did break down, and he didn't have an answer. I have to say I expected a little better customer service than that - I was basicaly fobbed off and made to feel as though I was a naggy guest.... Apart from that the rooms are fairly decent, clean, bathrooms are very tiny. Location is great 2 mins walk from Metro and close walking distance to Gran Via shopping and the centre Sol. I walked most places - and was able to walk back in the early hours of the morning on my own with no issues. It was always reassuring to see police on every corner deterring trouble. As a woman on my own I felt incredibly safe throughout Madrid. Internet in the hotel is not free but I was lucky enough to pick up a free wireless network from my room, that said it depended on which part of the room I was in, but if I tried close to the wall which backs onto the sister hotel - the Tryp Washington, I was able to pick it up no problem. So would recommend trying that first before paying for internet in the hotel. In fact I found quite a few free wifi points throughout my trip in Madrid so its always worth checking. I used the mini bar which was fairly reasonable prices compared to most hotels. For my return to Madrid I booked the Senator Spa Espana which is 2 doors up from the Tryp Menfis, and was a much better overall experience, for a similar rate I got breakfast included, free wifi, free minibar which included soft drinks (although no alcohol) a much bigger room and bathroom, and very very helpful staff - a seperate review to follow on that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: HardCorToronto
Reviews.Content: We loved the Tryp Menfis - everything about it, from the staff, to the terrific outside room balcony, location, breakfast, exercise room - really, everything. All were so helpful. And you can't beat the Museo del Jamon (it's a restaurant, not a museum) for excellent value and great food, just outside. I could not have had a better experience. The outside rooms were really terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: atlast5
Reviews.Content: I got a special deal on the Tryp Menfis that included the breakfast buffet with the room. The room was nice, clean and attractive. The bathroom was quite pretty with excellent lighting but a little small. Loved the big, big bath towels! The front desk staff were very professional and helpful. We had a problem with the air conditioning that they were not able to fix for the two nights we were there. That is my only complaint. They sent someone up to check and he said he would come back during the day to work on it. We went out for the day and when we returned in the evening, it still did not work well. Fortunately, in May it was still not very hot but we could not leave the balcony door open as it did not seem a safe thing to do. Our room was quiet because it was on the back side of the hotel. There was a nice variety of breads, eggs, meats, cheeses, juices, yogurt, fruit and delicious coffee on the breakfast buffet. The scrambled eggs were cold both mornings and the sausage links were not good. But with the amount of choices available, it was hard to leave hungry. The main waiter who brought our coffee was very nice and friendly. The location is just a few steps from the Plaza de Espana and from the metro stop of the same name. It's also a couple of blocks from the Palace. The Metro in Madrid is great and easy to use. We'd definitely stay at the Tryp Menfis again. We ate one night at La Gloria de Montera Restaurante as recommended by Rick Steves. I highly recommend it. Reasonable, generous portions, nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Quality in a vibrant district”
Reviews.Author: travel_wahoo
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Menfis is a typical upper-end European hotel, 4 stars in Madrid means a small room, but quality furnishings and cleanliness. Location at the end of Gran Via (closest Metro is either Plaza de Espana or Sol, depending on the line you're using) puts you near everything, but without the high room prices of other areas. A quick 10 minute walk puts you at the Puerta del Sol, Opera, Real Palace, or Plaza Mayor... all major attractions. I found that the Menfis had an excellent buffet, with something for all diets, as well as several excellent tapas-themed bars nearby, with some high-end restaurants as well. If you have to be American with your burger, there's a TGI Friday next door. Directly across the street is an excellent Tapas bar, Canas y Tapas, with some of the better tapas around the area. If you want pampering, this isn't the place, but if you want comfortable and safe surroundings, this is hard to beat. The only comparable hotels nearby might be the High Tech chain, whose properties tend to be off quieter streets than Gran Via. Bathrooms are indeed small for USA standards, but when traveling in Europe, just deal with it people! Do ask for a room off the Gran Via for slightly more quiet. This is Madrid, and people love their auto-horns at all hours. If you want quiet, definitely look elsewhere, but this hotel wins by a landslide on its location and comfort! Regarding Metro: Unlike other reviewers, I had no problem on the Metro to the airport, even with large luggage. It takes about 30 minutes, and costs 2 Euro each way, which is a bargain compared to a Taxi, which is more towards $30 each way, depending on passengers and luggage. The Madrid metro is exceedingly clean and modern, compared to anything in the USA, and is a safe and excellent option to get around this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “close to all interseting sights and good value for four stars and price”
Reviews.Author: sjordens
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to metrostation and city center. Gran Via is a big city road and very busy, in the hotel you do not hear the city at all. There is an airco. The beds are a bit hard but we like that so we slept very well. We could walk almost everything from the hotel. There are so many nice places to eat in the neighbourhoud, look for the real spanish tabernas and you wille a good meal for good value. The rooms are very clean. Our room was not so big but for a weekend fine. The bathroom is smallish and do not expect to brush your teeth there together..

Reviews.Title: “The premium rooms are four star quality great value”
Reviews.Author: calebbrewster
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Tryp hotel, both of which have been characterized by outstanding spacious four star rooms with luxury bathrooms at a great price, undoubtedly because the lobbies, corridors, location and other facilities of the hotel were not at the same level as the room. That's a compromise I'm glad to make for the price. I think the best hotels and location for touring Madrid are those across from the El Prado, but they are much more expensive. The location of the Tryp Menfis is at the end of Gran Via in a dense theater and restaurant district reminiscent of Times Square in New York,. The entry to the hotel is an inauspcious small storefront; and the lobby and corridors are subpar. But the premium room was outstanding with excellent buffet breakfast and in-room internet. Asked for and obtained rear room which was quiet. Room service was extremely limited and it was a long walk to obtain ice. Location is right next to Metro which connects everywhere. Although Madrid metro connects to the airport, it doesn't work with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunAndWork
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel ina verg Central Lochtöne Superb breakfast. Make Sure to get a quiet room, otherwise it might get vergloud. Air condition is a bit dated. Fitness facilities are Ok as well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: Stormlight
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Top location in the center of Madrid - Overall very clean - Great housekeeping The Bad: - Noisy in that you hear everything (and I mean everything!) your neighbour does - the mattress was way too soft (be warned if you have back problems) - The hotel has a bar but it is (or was) not staffed ... Overall, it's a good address smack in the center of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location, Top Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: quattromonti
Reviews.Content: Great Location (Gran Via), rooms with nice views of the main street of Madrid. Just across from Vips (good restaurant open till 3 am). The rooms are big, only snag is the bathroom, a bit small! Beds are nice and the Plasma TV is great! Breakfast is very very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hoitel”
Reviews.Author: coateseric
Reviews.Content: Agreat, recently refurbed hotel situated on The Gran Via , 100yds from The Espania Square. Walking didtance from many major tourist sites, easy access to the Metro and restaurants, cafe etc. Rooms are not large, but nicely furnished to a modern standard. Bathroom small but moderns facilities. Each room has a small balcony. Superb breakfast served each morning. Helpfull staff. Summary, Great location, modern clean facilities and a superb breakfast

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drtoews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6-night stay at the Tryp Menfis. The hotel is clean and well-maintained. The room was perfect for our needs and had a nice balcony view of the Gran Via street. Its location is very central for walking to many attractions if you like to walk. The breakfast buffet was a perfect way to start each day. We really appreciated the helpfulness of the staff and their efforts to make our stay in Madrid a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & central with good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights in late April-early May 2008, in a standard double room. The hotel and the room were decorated with care and kept very clean. The room had a balcony facing Gran Via and a nice bathroom with a tub. The use of a safe was included in the price, internet cost extra. The location is very central and the staff efficient. Breakfast includes fresh fruit and strawberries, cured Spanish ham, good sausages, fresh croissants and much more. From Barajas airport it's about a 45 min. ride by subway with one switch at Nuevos Ministerios, then off at Plaza de Espana station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Madrid sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Engineer_Bob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 7 nights during a two-week vacation in December 2007. The hotel is an easy walk to the Royal Palace, Plaza del Sol, and other major sights -- and there are two nearby metro stations for longer outings. Rooms were modern, clean, and well-maintained. Although only part of the desk staff spoke English, all were friendly and efficient. Our rate included a very acceptable buffet-style breakfast, which (unlike many other Spanish hotels) is served in a nice dining room with a street view instead of being hidden in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice & comfortable Hotel on Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in January on business. Great hotel located on Gran Via. Lots and lots of shops as you come out and beyond.....it is the main shopping street. Walking to distance to Sol and Opera....again lots of great cafes, tapas and restaurants to choose from. Would definately stay here again for the location. Room was large with king bed and separate sitting area (small but nice) to watch TV. Bathroom only had shower but that was fine. Breakfast is included in the price and it was very good selection of hot and cold with lots of pastries, cereals, coffee, and delicious yogurts all laid out in a fancy style. Dinner.....eat out! lots of tapas places to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lazboh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in September. Our room was clean and everything in it worked. Our room was in the back of the hotel and while we would have liked to have a view of the Gran Via, where we were was nice and quiet. We were able to sleep with the windows open on 2 of the cooler nights. The buffet breakfast was very good. It is a good location for a first visit to Madrid. I’m not sure we would stay there again, only because I am now more familiar with the city.

Reviews.Title: “I cant sleep”
Reviews.Author: khaled82
Reviews.Content: first of all the hotel location is great and I booked a premium room which is very nice and big which free internet Housekeeping is very nice she arranged everything more than u can imagine but as one of the member said the room facing a very bad area which is after 2am a lot of people start screaming, dancing, laughing no one to get your bags to the room or from the room with is difficult for me and not fair for 4 star hotel the front desk is rude and not helpful regards

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: kiwi88london
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, good location. Fine for a short weekend stay. However, as per another review - back of hotel fills up with young people playing very loud music / lots of shouting. Police were apparently called, but they started up again after police left. We made our booking through the Venere website, the price quoted included breakfast. However this was not communicated to the hotel and despite showing them our confirmatory email, they were adamant that we should pay for breakfast. Eventually the staff called their reservations person for help and then agreed to include breakfast in the quoted price - however, we were made to feel that this was our problem rather than a problem between the website who made the booking and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JImboChicago
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel. We were given a room on the second floor of the hotel facing the parking lot in the rear of the hotel. The parking lot fills up with young people after midnight and these people drink, yell and scream and play loud music until 4:30AM. We were unable to sleep the first two nights that we were there. The hotel staff did very little to correct the situation and were rude to my wife when we came to the lobby on the second evening to complain about the noise. The hotel reluctantly moved us to a different room for our third night after we insisted that we be moved to a different room. The hotel has a bar that never seemed to be open and no one offered to help with our bags when we arrived. If you do decide to stay at the hotel, insist that they give you a room on one of the higher floor facing Calle Gran Via. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location and the rooms are modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Repeating at Tryp Menfis”
Reviews.Author: Elna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in mid june and we had a very pleasant experience. We hadn’t booked in advance, but there was no problem. We checked availability and rates of this hotel by internet (because we had been there about one year and a half ago and we had had a very good stay there) and then we went directly to the hotel. Once we arrived, the man at the reception told us that the price was higher at reception than in internet, but he was very kind and he also informed us that if we wanted the internet rate, we could do the booking by phone at the moment and then do the checking immediately afterwards with the discount price. As he said, we phoned from the reception with our mobile phone and it worked out perfectly. We stayed in nice, new and big new room on the second floor (the whole hotel was being renewed by the first time we had stayed there). I loved the decoration, simple but modern. It makes you feel very comfortable. Our room windows were facing Gran Via which is a noisy street but the truth is that from the room, with the windows closed (room well tempered, air conditioning, heating…), we did not realise of the traffic noise at night. Location: Great. The hotel is just few steps from Plaza España and from a couple of metro lines. 15 minutes walking from Plaza del Sol and Plaza Mayor. There are plenty of places to have lunch or dinner near the hotel as well as the main shopping area. There are lots of theatres in Gran Via if you want to enjoy a good play, too. I’ve been to this hotel twice, I would repeat without hesitating and I would recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Muy bueno!”
Reviews.Author: Bosques
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mefis for one Friday night and was very happy with the hotel. As Expedia did not offer breakfast included, I booked direct with the hotel website which offered breakfast at no extra cost! The room I was allocated was on the 6th floor, very large, clean, modern and had a wonderful large balcony overlooking the Gran Via. Despite being on the Gran Via there was no problem with noise. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I have seen, great selection, all the usual offering including wonderful pastries. The location is excellent, 2 min from Plaza Espana metro station and within walking distance of all the main areas. If you're staying in Madrid for a long weekend or on buisness, the Mefis is an excellent choice, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Maritza5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in January for a weekend in this hotel. It is on the Gran Via, 5 minutes walk from the metro station Plaza Espana. We had a twin room with balcony overlooking Gran Via. Room and bathroom were spacious and very clean. Breakfast is oke. Very nice staff at the reception. Good service. We really loved this hotel, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: PGS1
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a good position to explore Madrid. Metro station within yards of the entrance. Although a 4 star hotel, not much to offer other than the room, which was large and clean but ideal for what we were looking for. A place to come back to after a good days walking around the streets of Madrid. Plenty of Bar's and Cafe's on the Gran Via to sample the local food and drink, VIPS an ideal place to get breakfast, one just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “just another city hotel”
Reviews.Author: eddiespain
Reviews.Content: excellent location, it was being refurbished when I stayed there. helpful reception, clean and correct.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TeresaPortugal
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights over the weekend. The Hotel is just 1 minute walk from Plaza Espana Metro station. Great location, in the Gran Via (full of bars, cafes, restaurants, shops and theaters). Very kind and helpful staff (reception and rooms) . Very clean rooms, very very comfortable beds and pillows. Buffet breakfast very nice with a good variety. I would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, and a great room”
Reviews.Author: zoony
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in the theatre/cinema part of Madrid. We stayed 4 nights over the weekend and at the beginning of the week in what the hotel calls a premium room for €125/night plus tax. See the photos..., it really was a big nice room on the 8th floor at the back of the building away from the traffic and the scaffolding (which I am beginning to believe is a permanent fixture). It's clean, modern and with most of the things that you might need... free wired internet, small desk, lovely bathroom (with a real live green growing plant in it!) and so on. Oh BTW if you want to use the internet in 8808 on the bed, then bring a 15ft wire! (make that 20’) Try not to have a car in town. It’s a pain to park and you have to subject yourself to maniacal Madrid driving (we only saw one crash in 5 days which surprised me immensely). We were big users of the metro to get about, but I can recommend the MadridVision tourist bus as a way to get your bearings (stop is only 2 minutes walk away on the Calle de la Princessa, although the recorded commentary sockets have only a 50% chance of working). This is the usual hop on/off thing but don't bother with this, just sit tight so you get to know where things are and swap from one route to the other. Then buy the 10-journey bus/metro ticket. A bar and breakfast room exist (I've not seen the bar) and the breakfasts are typical buffet-style but with the welcome addition of ample quantities of both hot and cold food. For dinner there are lots of local places for routine meals. Spanish chains like VIPS and Fresc are reasonable and convenient and popular with local people. VIPS is just across the road and there is a larger one just up the Gran Via. Plaza Callao is about 5 minutes walk up the Gran Via and there you can go into the El Corte Ingles basement supermarket for all kinds of food if you like. However, a word of warning about El Corte Ingles. They have adopted the scurrilous practice of converting your credit card purchases into your native currency WITHOUT telling you. You don’t lose big time, but you do lose. I should be more careful when I sign!

Reviews.Title: “The scaffolding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Club_Marin
Reviews.Content: It still has scaffolding in front of the hotel but we heard so much about it that we found the hotel immediately knowing that particularity. Excellent breakfast, good quality food, good selection and nice dining room. Our room was quiet, comfortable, clean with good AC. The only aspect we were disappointed with the hotel was the lack of help we had from the staff in helping us contacting Iberia about our lost luggages. For us it is much more difficult since we do not speak spanish very well. Beside that an excellent choice, hotel very well located, in the heart of everything, theatre, restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Tryp Menfis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. The hotel is very good although there is still scaffolding at the front of the hotel (Gran Via). Room was comfortable and modern (8th floor) and breakfast very good. Restaurants and bars and all historical sites close enough for walking. The open topped bus stop is about 50 metres away as is the nearest Metro station. Weather in April was good - 24C by day but cooling down overnight 13C. Bring a sweater. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasntly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home from a 3 night stay in Hotel Tryp Menfis in Madrid. Having read a couple of negative reviews about the hotel before we went I can only assume the writers had stayed elsewhere and become confused. The hotel fully deserves 4 stars, the rooms are modern, spacious and very clean, the staff are also very helpful. We didn't make it down for breakfast so can't comment on that, but the bar appeared to be closed at about 12.00am on Friday night, which was dissapointing as it offers views over the Calle de Gran Via. Very happy with the hotel and would definately recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gliz
Reviews.Content: Located by the Plaza de Espana, and within walking distance of the Palace. Easily accessed by the Metro. Rooms clean, airy, and with modern decor. Adequate buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid-Unless you have a fetish for scaffolding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When the taxi driver hadn't heard of the Tryp Menfis alarm bells started ringing. When he did eventually find it he stated it wasn't his fault because he couldn't see the hotel as the front was completely covered in scaffolding! After travelling we were mortified to see that the Menfis which was supposed to have been completely refurbsihed in 2004 was still being refurbished in September 2005 and the front was completely covered. On entering things didn't improve. We were met with a small dingy, depressing reception, tiny and just off the road. There was no bar. The reception was completely dated and the staff made no effort to assist us with our luggage up a steep flight of steps with no ramp. The rooms with balconies were also covered in scaffolding meaning guests were unable to sit out and enjoy the views of the bustling Gran Via. This hotel has a four star status that appears misplaced. We were told it was the most select hotel on the Gran Via which was stretching the truth. With the constant refurbishment, sub standard customer service, no public areas etc we were forced to take a "Tryp" elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: tour123
Reviews.Content: Althought rated at 4 stars, Tryp Menfis is not up to such standards. The furniture is old and scratched, the carpet has clear marks (despite the claim that the hotel was renovated in 1997), and some bathroom appliances in our room were defective. The temperature could not be controlled from our room (we stayed there at the end of November), and at night it was a bit cold. On the positive side, the location is definitely in a prime spot, on Gran Via, the room is very large (including a bedroom area and a living room), and the small balcony gives an excellent view of Gran Via and Plaza de Espana. We paid 70 euros a night through a promotion from Sol Melia (parent company), and I do not think the room is worth much more than that.
